name: Diversion-A
description:
On the eve of the 2078 offensive over the New Osaka region, Ayumi Nagata, Herschel Flugzeugewerke's administrator and chief test pilot, attempts to garner an advantage to the badly outnumbered forces of the Lansing-Koto Alliance via a desperate gamble; by committing the prototype of the company's most advanced fighter to a diversionary raid over Port Karas, hopefully to sufficient effect as to divert enemy resources from the Alliance's impending objective, and by extension rendering Commonwealth forces widely dispersed and susceptible to collapse under the weight of the forthcoming advance.

Diversion-A is an intense, vertically-scrolling Shoot' Em Up within a pseudo-representation of the bullet-hell genre, with 4 intense levels packed to the brim with an intricate assortment of enemies and bosses, to say nothing about an intense barrage of incoming projectiles.

Game Features

- 4 levels of intense, bullet-filled mayhem

- wide variety of enemies and bosses, with unique attack patterns

- 3 credits worth of continuous play

- intense particle effects

- completely original soundtrack

Controls

arrow keys - movement

Z - fire

X - crimson blast (smart bomb)

Esc - pause

System Requirements

Windows XP / Vista / 7 / or 8

250 MB hard drive space

DirectX 9.0

Pentium 2.0 Ghz or greater
